You can create an BollingerBands indicator object that is not bounded to any automatic update and choose which data it should use. To use it, please refer to the reference table below.

BollingerBands()1/1

            BollingerBands QuantConnect.Indicators.BollingerBands (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        period,
    Decimal                      k,
    *MovingAverageType           movingAverageType,
   )

Creates a new BollingerBands indicator which will compute the MiddleBand, UpperBand, LowerBand, and StandardDeviation

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose BollingerBands we seek.
Int32 period The period of the standard deviation and moving average (middle band).
Decimal k The number of standard deviations specifying the distance between the middle band and upper or lower bands.
*MovingAverageType movingAverageType (Optional) The type of moving average to be used.
(Optional) The resolution.
*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

BollingerBands - A BollingerBands configured with the specified period

Definition at file Indicators/BollingerBands.cs.


You can use two methods to update the indicator: automatic or manual.

Automatic Update

In this method, you will recreate the basic indicator usage: create the indicator with its constructor and register the indicator for automatic updates with the RegisterIndicator() method, but could be using a custom resolution via a Consolidator.

private BollingerBands _bb;
// In Initialize()
_bb = new BollingerBands(period, k);
_bb.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _bb, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_bb.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _bb.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.bb = BollingerBands(period, k)
self.bb.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.bb, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.bb.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.bb.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually allows you to control which data is used and create indicators of other non-regular price fields. The indicator objects have the Update() method that updates the state of the BollingerBands indicator with the given a trade bar, a quote bar, or a custom data bar.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private BollingerBands _bb;
// In Initialize()
_bb = new BollingerBands(period, k);

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(symbol))
{
    _bb.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_bb.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _bb.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.bb = BollingerBands(period, k)

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(symbol):
    self.bb.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High)
if self.bb.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.bb.Current.Value
